metadata.Title: CVE-2012-4415 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the guac_client_plugin_open function inlibguac in Guacamole before 0.6.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (crash) or execute arbitrary code via a long protocol name.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4415` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libguac3 - 0.6.0-2
No subscription required

guacd - 0.6.0-2
libguac-client-rdp0 - 0.6.0-2
libguac-client-ssh0 - 0.6.0-2
libguac-client-vnc0 - 0.6.0-2
libguac5 - 0.6.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libguac package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.6.0-2').
guacamole-server package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.6.0-2').
